author: michaelbirnbaum

author: michaelbirnbaum

text: Yes. Until it actually leaves the EU, it has the option.
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: By now, many E.U. policymakers think it best to break up and move on — a marked shift on a continent that once wanted Britain to stay. "“We don’t want in the coming months, in the coming years, to be busy with Brexit,” @guyverhofstadt said.
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: After May was dismissed, leaders talked and talked, disinviting her from a dinner of duck à l’orange to keep hammering out a deal. One ambassador tweeted a photo of a scrum of senior officials clustered in a corridor, some of them crouching on the ground.
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: One leader after another went around a ring-shaped table to hammer May about her political strategy, her preparations for a no-deal departure and why she wanted three months more. In all, she was grilled for nearly two hours — an eternity for a high-stakes summit.
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: Ahead of the meeting, @10DowningStreet exchanged a tense and unsmiling double-cheek-peck with Commission President @JunckerEU, with whom she has tangled. ("You called me nebulous!")
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: Leaders felt May was so removed from political realities that one European diplomat said her assessments were “a bit like coming from another planet," per @QuentinAries
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: The EU Brexit decision was a harsh verdict on May’s political acumen. Withering cross-examination led her fellow leaders to believe she had no political strategy to pass a divorce deal nor knew how Britain would weather an uncontrolled split next Friday.
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: From a close ally to Merkel:
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: Is it considered an insult to call him by his wife's name?
author: michaelbirnbaum

text: story doesn't correct headline; no correction needed. it's both at once: spending started rising before trump. it's continued to rise at least in part because of his push for more spending, according to the many defense officials i've interviewed on the matter. can be two things.
